page.title: 07Education in The Lee
page.content: There are 2{schools}in The Lee. At the Youth Centre in the mornings a private nursery school for about 20 children aged 3-5 is run by a teacher trained in the Montessori method, with 1 assistant. At the Lee Common Church of England First School, founded in 1873, there are about 50 pupils, aged 5-8. They come from The Lee,Ballinger, Lee Common, South Heath & outlying areas; & mostly make their own way to school, but if they live more than 2 miles away, free transport is provided. There are 3 classes,2.5{teachers,}2 welfare officers,1 cook + assistant, a cleaner & 2 dinner/playground supervisors. The vicar of The Lee is ex officio Chairman of the Board of Governors, but overall control is held by{Bucks County Council.}The general educational scheme covers basic literacy, numeracy & social conduct.
